Return to Part 1September 28, 2009 Albuquerque, New Mexico - In this series of Real X-Files, I amsharing my private 1980 files of high strangeness. But before I continue with thoseunpublished files, I want to insert a brief history of the American government's own TOPSECRET files related to UFO crash retrievals and the animal mutilation phenomenon.Since the May 1980 broadcast of my television documentary A STRANGE HARVEST, Ihave tried to find facts about the important question: What does the United Statesgovernment know about animal mutilations linked to non-human entities and technologiesretrieved from crashed discs which have provoked an American policy of misinformationand denial in the interest of national security since at least 1947?Back in 1983, while working on a documentary project for Home Box Office entitled,UFOs: The E.T. Factor, I met an elderly rancher who lived in Corona, New Mexico. Hesaid he had known Mac Brazel, the rancher who found strange debris on his land and wentto the Roswell Sheriff to report his discovery on July 4, 1947. The Corona resident toldme, “I heard there was a horrible secret about that crash.”Perhaps the answer to the “horrible secret” is the fear and shock that President Trumanand his close associates felt when they allegedly learned that dissected humans and/orhumanoids and animal parts were found in at least two of the UFOs that crashed in NewMexico in early July 1947. Interplanetary Phenomenon UnitOne of the many important documents gathered by Bob and Ryan Wood and displayed forstudy at their website, www.majestic12documents.com, is entitled: TOP SECRET ULTRAINTERPLANETARY PHENOMENON UNIT SUMMARY INTELLIGENCEASSESSMENT File Ref. 001947122-A.1206.This IPU document states:“The extraordinary recovery of fallen airborne objects in the state of NewMexico, between 4 July - 6 July 1947: This Summary was prepared byHeadquarters Interplanetary Phenomenon Unit, Scientific and TechnicalBranch, Counterintelligence Directorate, as requested by A. C. of S., G-2, atthe expressed order of Chief of Staff.”

TOP SECRET ULTRA Interplanetary PhenomenonUnit Summary Intelligence Assessment. Original date blacked out.The IPU Intelligence Assessment was re-classified TOP SECRET ULTRA on September 4,1960, by the authority of Lt. General John A. Samford, Director, National SecurityAgency, and approved by Allen Dulles, Director of the Central Intelligence Agency andstamped with the notice below: Upgraded, stricter re-classification of IPU Intelligence Assessmentapproved by Allen Dulles, Director, CIA, and by authority of Lt. GeneralJohn A. Samford, Director, NSA, on September 4, 1960.Text above: THIS DOCUMENT ? RE-CLASSIFIED ?AFFECTING THE NATIONAL SECURITY AND HAS BEENUPGRADED AS ABOVE ? WITH A "NEED TO KNOW'BASIS. ONLY THOSE ? PERSONS WITH MAJIC ACCESSMAY HAVE ACCESS. UPGRADING SCHEDULE TO ? ONLYWITH AN APPROVED PRESIDENTIAL E. O. [ ExecutiveOrder] WITH APPROVAL OF U. S. MAJESTICINTELLIGENCE AND SECURITY.By authority of: Lt. General John A. Samford, Dir., NSAApproved by: Allen Dulles, Director, CIADate: TOP SECRET September 4, 1960TOP SECRETULTRAJ.C.S. FILE COPYThree Disc Crash Retrievals Between July 4-6, 1947On Page 6 of the IPU Assessment, five alien bodies are described as they were found witha crashed aerial vehicle at a site on the northern end of the White Sands Missile Range inearly July 1947. The site is called LZ-2 in the report, which means, “Landing Zone 2” onWhite Sands territory between the Trinity Site and Oscura Peak. Landing Zone 1 is definedas the crash site between Corona and Roswell. A third Landing Zone 3 is defined as 30miles east of Alamogordo near the Mescalero Apache Indian Reservation. All threecrashes occurred between July 4 and July 6, 1947, according to the MJ-12 report.

IPU Assessment describes three UFO crash/retrieval sites referred to asLanding Zones1, 2 and 3, that occurred between July 4 and 6, 1947. Approximatelocations: LZ-1 between Corona and Roswell on the Mac Brazel ranch. LZ-2 at the TrinitySite in the northern end of what was then White Sands Proving Ground and todayis re-named White Sands Missile Range. LZ-3 east of Alamogordo near theMescalero Apache Indian Reservation southeastern border. Map by Linda Moulton Howe.On Page 2, Paragraph 4, the IPU Intelligence Assessment states: “On arrival at LZ-2,personnel assessed the finds as not belonging to any aircraft, rocket, weapons, or balloontest that are normally conducted from surrounding bases. First reports indicated that thefirst crash investigators from Roswell AAF that LZ-1 was the remains of a AAF top secretMOGUL balloon project. When scientists from the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratoryarrived to inspect LZ-2, it became apparent to all concerned that what had crashed in thedesert was something out of this world.”IPU Intelligence Assessment, Page 2, Paragraph 4. Description of Humanoid Bodies Recoveredat LZ-2, White Sands Proving GroundFurther along in the IPU Intelligence Assessment, Paragraph 11 states: “As to the bodiesrecovered at LZ-2, it appeared that none of the five crew members survived entry into ouratmosphere due to unknown causes. DR. DETLEV BRONK has been asked to assist in theautopsy of one well preserved cadaver to be done by MAJOR CHARLES E. REA. Fromwhat descriptions the team was able to learn and from photographs taken by intelligencephotographers, the occupants appear in most respects human with some anatomicaldifferences in the head, eyes, hands and feet. They have a slight build about five feet tall,with grayish-pink skin color. They have no hair on their bodies and clothed with a tightfitting flight suit that appears to be fire proof (some of the bodies looked as if they hadbeen burned on head and hands). Their overall stature reminds one of young children. It isbelieved that there were male and female genders present, but was hard to distinguish.

IPU Intelligence Assessment, Paragraph 11. “Bodies Disected (sic) As You Would A Frog”“The most disturbing aspect of this investigation was there were other bodies found not farfrom LZ-1 that looked as if they had been disected (sic) as you would a frog. It is notknown if army field surgeons had performed exploratory surgery on these bodies. Animalparts were reportedly discovered inside the craft at LZ-2 but this cannot be confirmed.The team has reserved judgement on this issue.” [Bold emphasis by Howe.]TOP SECRET ULTRA Interplanetary Phenomenon Unit Summary IntelligenceAssessment, Paragraph 12, about dissected bodies found near crashed UFO at LandingZone-1 between Corona and Roswell and animal parts discovered inside thenon-human craft at Landing Zone-2, Trinity Site, White Sands Proving Ground, NM.The IPU document does not make clear what he type of dissected bodies were - human?animal? non-human? Apparently those “disected (sic) bodies” were found on the ground“not far from Landing Zone-1” at the Corona site. But whatever the dissected bodieswere, in addition to the discovery of animal parts inside the craft at the White SandsLanding Zone-2, that disturbing physical evidence must have scared President Truman andhis colleagues so badly that they all agreed a tight lid must be placed on UFOs.A policy of complete denial in the interest of national security was demanded while thePresident and his advisers tried to learn more and figure out what they were up against.Thus, the National Security Act of 1947 created the Central Intelligence Agency, theMajestic-12 Special Studies Group and presidential executive orders that requiredeveryone associated with the extraterrestrial investigation to deliberately lie to andmisinform the press and the public in order to prevent panic and sustain national security. September 1979, KMGH-TVDenver, ColoradoKMGH-TV Producer-Director-Writer-Reporter and Editor

Linda Moulton Howe and Cameraman Richard Lerner, filming mutilatedsteer in Walsenberg, Colorado, October 1979, for documentary,A Strange Harvest, first broadcast on May 28, 1980.Colorado bovine's left side of head removed cleanly to bone;tongue removed deep in the throat; eyeball removed with excisionof tissue around eye, and left ear removed on July 26, 1977.I began to investigate the worldwide animal mutilation phenomenon back in the fall of1979. Eleven years before then in 1968, I had graduated from Stanford University with aMasters Degree in Communication in which I made documentaries at the Stanford MedicalCenter and the Stanford Linear Accelerator. Then I was hired by the NBC televisionaffiliate in Los Angeles to do news reporting and documentaries. Later I was hired byBoston's WCVB-TV (ABC) to produce medical and science programs that were honoredas part of the station's Peabody Award for programming excellence. After a family moveto Colorado, I was hired to be Director of Special Projects at the CBS television station inDenver, KMGH-TV. There I produced, wrote, directed, edited and reported documentaryfilms and live television studio programs about science, medical and environmental issues,which were honored with a national Emmy nomination, several regional Emmys, OhioState awards, Denver and Chicago Film Festivals best documentaries and other journalismawards.In the summer of 1979, dozens of animal mutilations were reported in Colorado again asthey had been periodically since the 1960s. I wanted to get to the bottom of what wascausing the unusual animal deaths and began an investigation which produced thedocumentary, A Strange Harvest, which received a 1981 regional Emmy. Linda Moulton Howe's A Strange Harvest hour television documentary received aregional Emmy in 1981. See Earthfiles Shop for more information.The bizarre, bloodless animal mutilations were not happening only in Colorado. Animalmutilations were occurring all over the United States, Canada and many other countries, allwith the same pattern of tissue removed from their bodies: an ear, an eye, a circle of flesharound the eye, half the jaw flesh, the tongue removed in a vertical cut deep within thethroat, as in this Sterling, Colorado, case back in the summer of 1976, and the mutilatedCaldwell, Kansas, cow in 1992.

Mutilated cow's head on the Budin ranchin Sterling, Colorado, 1976. Photograph by Sheriff Tex Graves,Logan County Sheriff's Office, Sterling, Colorado.Tongue removed deep within the throat; jaw flesh removedin clean “rectangle;” and yellow arrow points at two missing teethin Caldwell, Kansas, steer found on January 31, 1992.Photograph © 1992 by Chuck Pine.This steer in Caldwell, Kansas, discovered on January 31, 1992, was examined by aveterinarian pathologist who confirmed the cuts had been made with high heat. Also, theyellow arrow points at two missing teeth. This is a common characteristic of manymutilated cows, but not widely reported. Back in 1980 after my documentary, A StrangeHarvest, was first broadcast, I received a call from Lynn Lauber, head of the RoyalCanadian Mounted Police's (RCMP) animal mutilation investigation in Calgary, Alberta,Canada. He admitted to me that the common Calgary newspaper explanation of Sataniccults was not true, that he had no evidence. Further, he said many of the mutilated cattlethere had two teeth taken from either the upper or lower jaw, but he was keeping that factto himself in his investigations. I told him that Colorado law enforcement and I had alsotalked about missing teeth at mutilation sites and I agreed to keep that fact confidential aswell.Horses are often mutilated, such as the 14-year-old gelding below found June 22, 1993, byowner and horse raiser Doris Williams of New Raymer, Colorado. This was one of threemutilated animals found around the same time.Horse mutilation, Raymer, Colorado, June 22, 1993.Photograph © 1993 by Mike Peters, The Greeley Tribune.

The trachea and esophagus are often taken as in the Red Cloud, Nebraska, 1,000 poundChianina cow below discovered on November 27, 1989. In addition, the cow's optic nerve,eyeball and circle of flesh around the eye were cleanly excised and a large triangular patchof hide was taken from the belly, rectum and vagina.Trachea and esophagus were taken from this Red Cloud,Nebraska, cow along with its optic nerve, eyeball and circle of flesharound the eye, November 27, 1989. Photograph © 1989 by Ron Bartels.The pregnant, white bellied cow below was seen alive at noon and found dead andmutilated at 5 p.m. on September 9, 1982. The day was sunny and the owners, Linda andBill Dzuris of Elizabeth, Colorado, worked outside only a quarter mile from the pasture.Neither could understand how half the udder had been bloodlessly removed from thewhite belly of this cow without them hearing or seeing something.Close-up of pregnant cow's udder that had been cut in half;one-half was somehow removed bloodlessly between noon and 5 PM on the DzurisRanch, September 9, 1981, near Colorado Springs, Colorado. Photograph © 1982by Linda Dzuris, five hours after the pregnant cow was last seen alive.In Nounan, Idaho, on October 9, 1989, all four teats were neatly and bloodlessly removedfrom the udder of the young female cow below.Four teats removed, Nounan, Idaho, October 9, 1989.Photograph © 1989 by Bear Lake County Sheriff Deputy.The penis and testicles are often cleanly removed from the belly of male animals in whatlaw enforcement has long referred to as “cookie cutter” cuts. A good example is the bullcalf below found dead and mutilated on the Modesto Mendicoa ranch in Manila, Utah. TheDaggett County Sheriff's office investigated and took photographs on October 22, 1982.

Penis and testicles removed on bull calf in bloodless “cookie cutter”excision on the Modesto Mendicoa ranch in Manila, Utah. Photographstaken on October 22, 1982, by Daggett County Sheriff's Deputy.Rectal tissue is almost always taken from both sexes, such as this young calf in Sterling,Colorado, found dead on April 20, 1976. The tail was also cut off at end of tail bone, butnot found at the scene, as in several other cases over the years.Young calf found April 20, 1976, near Sterling, Colorado,with its tail cut off and rectum cored out. Polaroid photographby Logan County Sheriff Tex Graves.Animals are found dead and mutilated on powder dirt, wet sand, and pasture grass withouta single track around them, not even their own tracks. One example is the pregnant cowowned by Bill Veenhuizen of Maple Valley, Washington. He found his cow dead on July17, 1989, with a “keyhole” excisions of jaw flesh, bone, teeth, tongue and a large,hide-deep excision of rectal and vaginal tissue.Pregnant cow found dead and mutilated on July 17, 1989,Maple Valley, Washington. Photograph © 1989 by Bill Veenhuizen.Many bloodless excisions have had a serrated edge which veterinarian pathologists haveconfirmed was made with high heat, such as the one below described as “a heat inducedincision” by the Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory, College of Veterinary Medicine, OregonState University, Corvallis, Oregon, in 1990. Lasers are an obvious first thought, but theanimal excisions examined under a microscope do not have carbon residue, which iscommonly found after laser surgeries since cattle, horses, other animals and humans are all

carbon-based life forms.Close-up profile of 1990 Oregon steer's serrated excision,cut with high heat. Photograph © 1990 by Keith E. Rowell.These are some of the mysterious aerial lights that have long been seen and photographedover pastures where animal mutilations have occurred. Below, on the left in black andwhite, are time exposure photos taken by reporter Bill Jackson in Sterling, Colorado, in1976. On the right are color time exposures by Jim Williamson, Editor of the Little RiverNews in Ashdown, Arkansas.Four time exposure photos of mysterious lights above pasturesduring intense animal mutilation activity. B&W on left in Colorado© 1976 by Bill Jackson; color on right in Arkansas © 1989 by Jim Williamson.That's why law enforcement looked to the sky, and newspapers started illustrating whatranchers said they had seen, like the illustration below in the November 2, 1980, GreeleyTr ibune in Greeley, Colorado.Cartoon depiction of cow rising in beam of light in articleabout the animal mutilation mystery, November 2, 1980,Greeley Tribune, Greeley, Colorado.The United States military had knowledge of Something coming from the skies and killingand mutilating animals around the world since at least the early 1950s according to retiredU. S. Army Lt. Col. Philip J. Corso, now deceased, who wrote the important 1997 book,The Day After Roswell.

In his book, Col. Corso described many advanced technologies that the United Statesgovernment retrieved from crashed non-human aircraft and back-engineered. One of thosetechnologies, according to Col. Corso, was what came to be known as a laser scalpel inmodern Earth medicine. On Page 47 of his book, Col. Corso wrote: “Why did theextraterrestrial inhabitants of the craft have a cutting device like this aboard their ship? Itwasn't until later, when I read highly classified military reports of cattle mutilations inwhich entire organs were removed without any visible trauma to the surrounding celltissue, that I realized that the light-beam cutting torch...was being used by the aliens inmedical experiments on our livestock.”Graphic of laser scalpel surgery on eye.Before he died, Col. Corso talked to me in private about the many classified documents hehad seen in Washington, D. C., when he returned from his World War II assignment inItaly. He told me that he had read with his own eyes highly classified reports dated asearly as 1951 about animals found in several parts of the world with bloodless excisionsand no tracks around them, not even the dead animal's own tracks, implying the mutilatedanimal had been dropped to the ground from the air. Col. Corso said classified governmentreports he read specified that the animal mutilators were “extraterrestrial biologicalentities.”U. S. Army Lt. Col. Philip J. Corso with Linda Moulton Howe at50th anniversary event in Roswell, New Mexico, July 4, 1997.Animal mutilations was such a sensitive and classified subject, Col. Corso told me, becausethe United States government was scared that if the public knew Something from outerspace was able to pick up heavy animals in beams of light, remove tissue and liquids withinstruments that cut with light and perhaps sound frequencies, then return the animals deadand mutilated to pastures - Americans, and the world, would panic. Also, the advancedtechnologies needed to be kept out of the hands of human enemies and developed andpatented by American companies.

Sketch of silver disc in Missouri horse pasture whereseveral mutilated foals had been found in mid-1970s.Artist depiction by Lisa Dusenberry.I think the Corona rancher's reference to a “horrible secret” at the Corona, New Mexico,crash had to do with the worldwide animal mutilation phenomenon, which seems linked toa large scale genetic harvest of this planet.Continued in Part 3Return to Part 1More Information:For further information about worldwide animal mutilations, please see EarthfilesArchive for ten years of reports (a few titles listed below).
